person.persName: Arthur McArthur, Sr. (Wisconsin lieutenant governor, governor, attorney, and judge)

body.p: Wisconsin lieutenant governor, governor, attorney, and judge. Native of Glasgow, Scotland. Married to Aurelia Belcher McArthur. Father of Arthur McArthur, Jr. and Francis McArthur. Graduate of Wesleyan University. Admitted to the bar in Massachusetts and New York in 1840. Moved to Milwaukee in 1849. Member of the Democratic Party. City Attorney for Milwaukee in 1851. Lieutenant governor of Wisconsin, under Governor William A. Barstow, in 1855. Governor for a four day period in 1856. He resigned and continued his service as lieutenant governor of Wisconsin until 1858. Judge of the Milwaukee Circuit Court from 1858 to 1869.
